title: آية الكرسي
arabicText: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ لَّهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۗ مَن ذَا الَّذِي يَشْفَعُ عِندَهُ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَيْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِ إِلَّا بِمَا شَاءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ وَلَا يَئُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْعَظِيمُ
transliteration: Allahu la ilaha illa huwa al-hayyu al-qayyum, la ta'khudhuhu sinatun wa la nawm, lahu ma fi al-samawati wa ma fi al-ard, man dha alladhi yashfa'u 'indahu illa bi-idhnih, ya'lamu ma bayna aydihim wa ma khalfahum, wa la yuhituna bi-shay'in min 'ilmihi illa bima sha'a, wasi'a kursiyyuhu al-samawati wa al-ard, wa la ya'uduhu hifdhuhuma, wa huwa al-'aliyu al-'adhim
translation: Allah! There is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
benefit: من قرأها في صباحه كفاه الله ما أهمه من أمر الدنيا والآخرة
benefitEn: Whoever recites it in the morning, Allah will suffice him in matters of this world and the Hereafter

title: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ
titleEn: Glory be to Allah and praise Him
translation: Glory be to Allah and praise Him
benefit: من قالها في يوم مائة مرة حُطَّت خطاياه وإن كانت مثل زبد البحر
benefitEn: Whoever says it 100 times a day will have his sins forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea

title: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّات
titleEn: I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah
arabicText: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
transliteration: A'udhu bi-kalimati Allahi at-tammati min sharri ma khalaq
translation: I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah from the evil of what He has created
benefit: من قالها ثلاثاً إذا أمسى لم تضره حُمَة تلك الليلة
benefitEn: Whoever says it three times in the evening will be protected from harmful stings that night

title: الاستغفار
translation: I seek forgiveness from Allah and repent to Him
benefit: كان النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم يستغفر الله في اليوم مائة مرة
benefitEn: The Prophet (peace be upon him) used to seek Allah's forgiveness 100 times a day

title: باسمك اللهم أموت وأحيا
titleEn: In Your Name, O Allah, I live and die
translation: In Your Name, O Allah, I die and live
benefit: من السنة أن يقولها المسلم عند النوم
benefitEn: It is from the Sunnah for a Muslim to say this before sleeping

title: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ - الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ - اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
arabicText: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ (33)، الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ (33)، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ (34)
translation: Glory be to Allah (33), Praise be to Allah (33), Allah is the Greatest (34)
benefit: من سبح الله دبر كل صلاة ثلاثاً وثلاثين، وحمد الله ثلاثاً وثلاثين، وكبر الله ثلاثاً وثلاثين، فتلك تسع وتسعون، ثم قال تمام المائة: لا إله إلا الله وحده لا شريك له، له الملك وله الحمد وهو على كل شيء قدير، غُفرت خطاياه وإن كانت مثل زبد البحر
benefitEn: Whoever glorifies Allah after every prayer 33 times, praises Allah 33 times, and magnifies Allah 33 times (99), then completes 100 by saying: 'There is no deity except Allah, alone without partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is over all things competent' - his sins will be forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea
